fields.label: Total number of participations  by private commercial organisations in FP7-ICT projects
fields.alt_label: Total number of private commercial organisations'participations in FP7-ICT projects
fields.definition: Total number of participations by private commercial organisations (SMEs and large enterprises)in ICT research projects under the EU's Seventh Framework Programme (FP7) - Cooperation and Capacities (e-infrastructures). Each project has multiple partners participating and each partner can participate in multiple projects.

fields.label: Total number of participations by SMEs in FP7-ICT projects
fields.alt_label: Total number of SMEs' participations in FP7-ICT projects
fields.definition: Total number by participations of SMEs in ICT research projects under the EU's Seventh Framework Programme (FP7) - Cooperation and Capacities (e-infrastructures). Each project has multiple partners participating and each partner can participate in multiple projects.

fields.label: Total cost of FP7-ICT projects
fields.definition: Value of the total cost of the ICT research projects for which a grant agreement was signed in the reference year, under the EU's Seventh Framework Programme (FP7). Total cost of the project is the sum of participants' total costs.

fields.label: GBAORD - Government budget appropriations or outlays for research and development
fields.definition: GBAORD include all appropriations (government spending) given to R&D in central (or federal) government budgets. Provincial (or State) government posts are only included if the contribution is significant. Local government funds are excluded
fields.note: From 2006 onwards figures were revised and updated by PREDICT 2 project

fields.label: Public ICT R&D spending (GBAORD in the field of ICT)
fields.definition: Estimate of the ICT share in existing disaggregated GBAORD data, based on the assumption that the share of research in the ICT field in GBAORD expenditure is proportional to the share of ICT specialists in the R&D labour cost. Methodology developped and implemented by JRC-IPTS.
fields.note: From 2006 onwards figures were revised and updated by PREDICT 2 project

fields.label: GDP - Gross domestic product at market prices
fields.definition: Eurostat estimation of GDP and main components - Current prices [nama_gdp_c]

fields.label: H2020 effective cofinancing rate
fields.definition: The cofinancing rate is the % of projects total costs which are covered by EC funding grants.

fields.label: Total EC funding to participants in H2020 ICT projects
fields.alt_label: Total EC funding to H2020 ICT projects
fields.definition: Value of European Commission funding committed through grant agreements signed, during the reference year, with participants in ICT research projects under Horizon 2020 (LEIT ICT, Excellent Science, Societal Challenges 1, 6 and 7). Projects under negotiation are not included.

fields.label: Number of distinct organisations participating in H2020 ICT projects for the first time
fields.alt_label: Number of new organisations in H2020 projects
fields.definition: Organisations participating for the first time in H2020 ICT calls, and which have not participated in FP7 ICT calls during 2007-2013 period.

fields.label: Number of distinct organisations participating in H2020 ICT projects
fields.definition: Organisations participating in H2020 ICT projects during the reference year.

fields.label: Total number of participations in H2020 ICT projects
fields.definition: Each project has multiple partners participating and each partner can participate in multiple projects. For each participation there could be an EC funding (some participations do not receive EC funding).

fields.label: Total cost of H2020 ICT projects
fields.alt_label: Total cost of H2020 ICT projects
fields.definition: Value of the total cost of the ICT research projects for which a grant agreement was signed in the reference year, under the Horizon 2020 LEIT ICT, Excellent Science, Societal Challenges 1, 6 and 7). Total cost of the project is the sum of participants' total costs.

fields.label: Average EC funding per participation in H2020 ICT projects
fields.alt_label: H2020 Average EC funding per participation
fields.definition: EC funding is the funding committed by the European Commission through grant agreements signed during the reference year. The indicator measures the average EC funding attributed to each partner participation in a specific project.

fields.label: Households with fixed broadband connection
fields.definition: Household internet connection type: fixed broadband

fields.label: Households having a broadband connection
fields.definition: Broadband connection used by the household includes: DSL, wired fixed (cable, fiber, Ethernet, PLC), fixed wireless (satellite, WiFi, WiMax) and mobile wireless (3G/UMTS).
fields.note: Scope includes Households with at least one member aged 16-74.

fields.label: Households with fast fixed broadband connection
fields.alt_label: Households with fast fixed broadband connection
fields.definition: Households with fast fixed broadband connection

fields.label: Households with access to the Internet at home
fields.alt_label: Households with access to the Internet at home
fields.definition: Any member of the household has access to the Internet at home
fields.note: Scope includes Households with at least one member aged 16-74.

fields.label: Households with ultrafast fixed broadband connection
fields.alt_label: Households with ultrafast fixed broadband connection
fields.definition: Households with ultrafast fixed broadband connection

fields.label: Households that have no access to Internet at home, because the costs are too high
fields.alt_label: Households with no access to Internet at home, because the costs are too high
fields.definition: Households that have no access to Internet at home, because the costs are too high

fields.label: GPs exchanging medical patient data with other healthcare providers and professionals
fields.alt_label: GPs exchanging medical patient data with other healthcare providers and professionals
fields.definition: Percentatge of general practitioners using electronic networks to exchange medical patient data with other healthcare providers and professionals

fields.label: GPs using electronic networks to transfer prescriptions to pharmacists
fields.alt_label: GPs using electronic networks to transfer prescriptions to pharmacists
fields.definition: Percentatge of general practitioners using electronic networks to transfer prescriptions to pharmacists

fields.label: Number of households
fields.definition: Estimation of the number of Households with at least one member aged 16-74, for the purpose of the survey on ICT usage by individuals and households.

fields.label: Number of private Households
fields.definition: Number of private households (Eurostat table lfst_hhnhwhtc)

fields.label: Individuals using anti-tracking software
fields.definition: Individuals using anti-tracking software

fields.label: Individuals who did not encounter problems when buying/ordering goods or services over the internet for private use
fields.alt_label: Individuals who had no problems buying/ordering goods or services over the internet for private use
fields.definition: Individuals who had no problems buying/ordering goods or services over the internet for private use

fields.label: Individuals ordering goods or services online, from sellers from other EU countries
fields.definition: Individuals that ordered goods or services for private use over the Internet in the last 12 months from sellers from other EU countries

fields.label: Individuals ordering content or software delivered online or offline
fields.definition: Online purchases: films/music or books/magazines/e-learning material or computer software

fields.label: Individuals ordering content or software that were delivered or upgraded online
fields.definition: The online content and software include: films, music, books, magazines, e-learning material, computer software, video games, that were ordered/bought over the Internet in the last 12 months, for non-work use.

fields.label: Individuals ordering goods or services online
fields.definition: Individuals carrying out this activity over the internet in the last 12 months, for private use.

fields.label: Individuals ordering physical goods online
fields.definition: Individuals that have ordered online any of the following physical goods: food/groceries, household goods, medicine, clothes/sports, computer hardware, electronic equipment.

fields.label: Individuals ordering services online
fields.definition: Individuals that have ordered online any of the following services: telecommunications services, share/insurance/financial, holiday accomodation, travel arrangements, tickets for events.

fields.label: Used internet storage space to save documents, pictures, music, video or other files
fields.definition: Used internet storage space to save documents, pictures, music, video or other files

fields.label: workers who judge their current ICT skills sufficient for changing job within a year
fields.alt_label: ICT skills perceived as sufficient for the labour market
fields.definition: Individuals with an occupation as employees, self-employed or family workers, were asked if they judge their current computer or Internet skills to be sufficient (yes/not) if they were to look for a job or change job within a year.

fields.label: workers who judge their current ICT skills insufficient for changing job within a year
fields.alt_label: ICT skills perceived as insufficient for the labour market
fields.definition: Individuals with an occupation as employees, self-employed or family workers, were asked if they judge their current computer or Internet skills to be sufficient (yes/not) if they were to look for a job or change job within a year.

fields.label: Individuals who know that cookies can be used to trace movements of people on the internet
fields.definition: Individuals who know that cookies can be used to trace movements of people on the internet

fields.label: Individuals who have written a computer program using a specialised programming language
fields.definition: Individuals who have written a computer program using a specialised programming language.
fields.note: Break in series because before 2015 the activity could have been carried out ever, but since 2015 it refers to the last 12 months .

fields.label: Individuals with medium or high computer skills (3 or more of 6 computer activities)
fields.alt_label: Individuals with medium or high computer skills
fields.definition: The indicator counts individuals having ever carried out at least 3 of the following 6 activities: coping or moving a file or folder, using copy and paste tools, using basic arithmetic formula in a spreadsheet, compressing (or zipping) files, connecting and installing new devices, writing a computer program using a specialised programming language. Only those having ever used a computer were proposed the question.

fields.label: Individuals who have created a Web page
fields.definition: The activity could have been carried out ever. Only those having ever used the internet were proposed the question.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with above basic overall digital skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 -  Above basic overall digital skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Individuals with  “above basic digital skills” in all 5 areas.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic overall digital skills
fields.definition: The skills in 5 areas are at 'at least basic level' (some can be “basic” and some can be “above basic”, but not all 5 areas are “above basic”.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with at least basic overall digital skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - At least basic overall digital skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: The sum of basic and above basic skills.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with above basic communication and collaboration  skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Communication and collaboration - Above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Above basic: more than one activity from activities used for calculating the communication and collaboration skills

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic communication and collaboration  skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Communication and collaboration - Basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Basic: one activity from activities used for calculating the communication and collaboration skills

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic or above basic communication and collaboration skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Communication and collaboration - Basic or above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: At least basic skills - sum of basic and above basic skills.
fields.note: Definition in Digital Competence Framework 2.0: To interact, communicate and collaborate through digital technologies while being aware of cultural and generational diversity. To participate in society through public and private digital services and participatory citizenship. To manage one’s digital identity and reputation.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with above basic digital content creation  skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Digital content creation - Above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Above basic: 3 or more activities from activities used for calculating the digital content creation skills

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic digital content creation skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Digital content creation - Basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Basic: one or two activities from activities used for calculating the digital content creation skills

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic or above basic digital content creation skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Digital content creation - Basic or above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: At least basic skills - sum of basic and above basic skills.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with online information and communication skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Online information and communication skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Individuals with online information and communication skills (at “basic” or “above basic” level) and have “no skills” in 3 remaining areas (Digital content creation, Safety, and Problem solving)

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with above basic information and data literacy  skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Information and data literacy- Above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Above basic: more than one activity from activities used for calculating the information and data literacy skills.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic information and data literacy  skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Information and data literacy - Basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Basic: one activity from activities used for calculating the information and data literacy skills.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic or above basic information and data literacy  skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Information and data literacy - Basic or above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: At least basic skills - sum of basic and above basic skills.
fields.note: Definition in Digital Competence Framework 2.0:  To articulate information needs, to locate and retrieve digital data, information and content. To judge the relevance of the source and its content. To store, manage, organize digital data, information and content.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with limited overall digital skills (2 out of 5)
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Limited overall digital skills (2 out of 5) - (from 2021)
fields.definition: Individuals have “basic” or “above basic” level in 2 areas and “no skills” in 3 areas (2 out of 5).

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with low overall digital skills (4 out of 5)
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Low overall digital skills (4 out of 5) - (from 2021)
fields.definition: Individuals have “basic” or “above basic” level in 4 areas and “no skills” in 1 area (4 out of 5).

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with narrow overall digital skills (3 out of 5)
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Narrow overall digital skills (3 out of 5) - (from 2021)
fields.definition: Individuals have “basic” or “above basic” level in 3 areas and “no skills” in 2 areas (3 out of 5).

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Digital skills could not be assessed because the individual has not used the internet in the last 3 months
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Digital skills could not be assessed because the individual has not used the internet in the last 3 months (from 2021)
fields.definition: Individuals that have not used the internet in the last 3 months and skills could have not been assessed.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with above basic problem solving  skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Problem solving- Above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: Above basic: 3 or more activities from activities used for calculating the problem solving  skills

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic problem solving skills
fields.definition: Basic: one or two activities from activities used for calculating the problem solving  skills

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic or above basic problem solving skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Problem solving - Basic or above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: At least basic skills - sum of basic and above basic skills.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with above basic safety  skills
fields.definition: Above basic: 3 or more activities from activities used for calculating the safety skills

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic safety skills
fields.definition: Basic: one or two activities from activities used for calculating the safety skills

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with basic or above basic safety skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2.0 - Safety - Basic or above basic skills (from 2021)
fields.definition: At least basic skills - sum of basic and above basic skills.

fields.label: DSI 2.0 - Individuals with no overall digital skills
fields.definition: Individuals have “no skills” in 4 areas or “no skills” in all 5 areas despite declaring having used the internet at least once during last 3 months.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with above basic level of digital skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Above basic level of skills
fields.definition: Persons that have been using internet during last 3 months are attributed a score on four digital competence domains: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving, depending the activities they have been able to do. The scores in each domain are basic, above basic and below basic. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills. To be classified "basic or above basic" on the overall indicator an individual has to have basic or above basic skills in all the four Digital Competence domains included in the index: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving.
fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with at least basic digital skills
fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - At least basic digital skills
fields.definition: Persons that have been using internet during last 3 months are attributed a score on four digital competence domains: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving, depending the activities they have been able to do. The scores in each domain are basic, above basic and below basic. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills. To be classified "basic or above basic" on the overall indicator an individual has to have basic or above basic skills in all the four Digital Competence domains included in the index: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving.
fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with above basic level of digital skills in Communication domain
fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Communication Domain - Above Basic Skills
fields.definition: These skills refer to the ability to communicate in digital environments, share resources through online tools, link with others and collaborate through digital tools, interact with and participate in communities and networks, cross-cultural awareness. The indicator is based on four activities internet users have been able to do online during previous 3 months. The scores are basic, above basic and none. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills.
fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with at least basic digital skills in Communication domain
fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Communication Domain - At least Basic  Skills
fields.definition: These skills refer to the ability to communicate in digital environments, share resources through online tools, link with others and collaborate through digital tools, interact with and participate in communities and networks, cross-cultural awareness. The indicator is based on four activities internet users have been able to do online during previous 3 months. The scores are basic, above basic and none. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills.
fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with no digital skills in Communication domain
fields.definition: These skills refer to the ability to communicate in digital environments, share resources through online tools, link with others and collaborate through digital tools, interact with and participate in communities and networks, cross-cultural awareness. The indicator is based on four activities internet users have been able to do online during previous 3 months. The scores are basic, above basic and none. fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Information Domain - Above Basic Skills
fields.definition: Information processing skills refers to the ability to identify, locate, retrieve, store, organise and analyse digital information, judging its relevance and purpose. The indicator is based on five activities internet users have been able to do online during previous 3 months. The scores are basic, above basic and none. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills.
fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with low level of digital skills (missing some type of basic skills)
fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Individuals with "low" level of skills
fields.definition: Persons that have been using internet during last 3 months are attributed a score on four digital competence domains: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving, depending the activities they have been able to do. The scores in each domain are basic, above basic and below basic. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills. To be classified "basic or above basic" on the overall indicator an individual has to have basic or above basic skills in all the four Digital Competence domains included in the index: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with above basic level of digital skills in Problem solving domain
fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Problem Solving Domain - Above Basic Skills
fields.definition: Problem solving skills refers to the ability to identify digital needs and resources, make informed decisions as to which are the most appropriate digital tools according to the purpose or need, solve conceptual problems through digital means, creatively use technologies, solve technical problems, update one's own and others' competences. The indicator is based on three basic digital problems and familiarity with four online services internet users have been able to do during previous 3 months. The scores are basic, above basic and none. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills.
fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with at least basic digital skills in Problem solving domain
fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Problem Solving Domain - At least Basic  Skills

The indicator is based on three basic digital problems and familiarity with four online services internet users have been able to do during previous 3 months. The scores are basic, above basic and none. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills.

fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Problem Solving Domain - No Skills
fields.definition: Problem solving skills refers to the ability to identify digital needs and resources, make informed decisions as to which are the most appropriate digital tools according to the purpose or need, solve conceptual problems through digital means, creatively use technologies, solve technical problems, update one's own and others' competences. The indicator is based on three basic digital problems and familiarity with four online services internet users have been able to do during previous 3 months. The scores are basic, above basic and none. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills.
fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with above basic level of digital skills in Software domain
fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Software Domain - Above Basic Skills
fields.definition: Software skills for content manipulation refer to the ability to create and edit new content (from word processing to images and video); integrate and re-elaborate previous knowledge and content; produce creative expressions, media outputs and programming; deal with and apply intellectual property rights and licences. The indicator is based on six activities internet users have been able to do during previous 3 months. The scores are basic, above basic and none. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills.

fields.alt_label: DSI 2015-2019 - Software Domain - At least Basic  Skills

fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

fields.label: DSI 2015-2019 Individuals with no digital skills
fields.definition: Persons that have been using internet during last 3 months are attributed a score on four digital competence domains: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving, depending the activities they have been able to do. The scores in each domain are basic, above basic and below basic. Individuals not using internet are classified without digital skills. To be classified "basic or above basic" on the overall indicator an individual has to have basic or above basic skills in all the four Digital Competence domains included in the index: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving.
fields.note: Detailed results are available in the Eurostat table ISOC_SK_DSKL_I. Consult the methodological note on DG CONNECT newsroom.

fields.label: Individuals who are frequent internet users (every day or almost every day)
fields.definition: Individuals using the internet every day or almost every day, in the last 3 months.

fields.label: Individuals submitting completed forms to public authorities, over the internet, last 12 months
fields.alt_label: Citizens submitting filled forms to eGov services, last 12 months

fields.label: sending filled forms to public authorities, over the internet, last 3 months
fields.alt_label: Sending filled forms to eGov services, last 3 months
fields.note: Indicator collected until 2010.

fields.label: seeking online information about health
fields.definition: Individuals using internet in the last 3 months, seeking information about health: injury, disease, nutrition, improving health, etc.

fields.label: Individuals who have used internet in the last 12 months
fields.alt_label: Internet used in the last 12 months

fields.label: Individuals with medium or high internet skills (3 or more of 6 internet activities)
fields.alt_label: Individuals with medium or high internet skills
fields.definition: The indicator counts individuals having ever carried out at least 3 of the following 6 activities: using a search engine to find information, sending e-mails with attached files, posting messages to chatrooms, newsgroups or an online discussion forum, using the internet to make telephone calls, using peer-to-peer file sharing for exchanging movies or music, creating a webpage. Only those having ever used the internet were proposed the question.

fields.label: Individuals who have used internet in the last 3 months
fields.alt_label: Internet used in the last 3 months

fields.label: Individuals accessing the Internet through a mobile phone via UMTS (3G)
fields.alt_label: Use of mobile phones to access the Internet
fields.definition: Individuals using a mobile phone or smart phone to access the internet, in the last 3 months. Since 2011 the question specify "away from home or work". Until 2012  the question was limited to "via UMTS, HSDPA (3G or 3G+) connections".
fields.note: Break in series in 2011 and 2012 as the structure of the question has changed. Reconstructed time series using Eurostat variables: i_iu3g, i_iu3G1, i_iuhd_mph, i_iump_mph

fields.label: using online banking
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for Internet banking

fields.label: looking online for information about education, training or course offers
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for looking for information about education, training or course offers

fields.label: playing or downloading games, images, films or music
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for playing or downloading games, images films or music
fields.note: Biennial indicator not collected in 2011

fields.label: interacting online with public authorities, last 3 months
fields.alt_label: Use of eGovernment services, last 3 months
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for interaction with public authorities. It includes obtaining information from public authorities web sites, downloading official forms and sending filled in forms.

fields.label: Individuals interacting online with public authorities, last 12 months
fields.alt_label: Citizens' use of eGovernment services, last 12 months
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 12 months, for interaction with public authorities. It includes obtaining information from public authorities web sites, OR downloading official forms OR sending filled in forms.

fields.label: looking for information about goods and services online
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for finding information about goods and services

fields.label: looking online for a job or sending a job application
fields.alt_label: Looking for a job, sending a job application
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for looking for a job or sending a job application

fields.label: making an appointment with a practitioner via a website
fields.alt_label: Appointment with a practitioner via a website
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for making an appointment with a practitioner via a website (e.g. of a hospital or a health care centre)
fields.note: Biennial indicator

fields.label: Individuals using a laptop/tablet to access the internet, away from home or work
fields.alt_label: Nomadic use of laptop/tablet to access the Internet
fields.definition: Individuals using a portable computer (laptop) to access the internet away from home or work via any wireless connection (WiFi or cellular networks), in the last 3 months. Since 2012 the question explicitly mention also tablet computer (with touch screen).
fields.note: Break in series in 2011 and 2012 as the structure of the question has changed. Reconstructed time series using Eurostat varibales: i_iuport, i_iuport1, i_iumc

fields.label: reading / downloading online newspapers / news magazines
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for reading / downloading online newspapers / news magazines

fields.label: doing an online course (in any subject)
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for doing an online course (of any subject)

fields.label: telephoning or video calls (via webcam) over the internet
fields.note: Biennial indicator. Break in time series between 2007 and 2008 because of new wording. Reconstructed time series using Eurostat varibales: i_iuph and i_iuph1.

fields.label: Individuals who are regular internet users (at least once a week)
fields.definition: Individuals using the internet at least once a week in the last 3 months.

fields.label: Individuals selling goods or services online (e.g. via auctions)
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for selling goods and services (e.g. via auctions)

fields.label: participating in social networks, over the internet, last 3 months
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for participating in social networks (creating user profile, posting messages or other contributions to facebook, twitter, etc.)

fields.label: uploading self-created content to be shared
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for uploading self-created content (text, images, photos, videos, music, etc.)
fields.note: Biennial indicator not collected in 2011.

fields.label: Individuals watching video on demand from commercial services
fields.alt_label: Individuals watching video on demand from commercial services
fields.definition: Individuals watching video on demand from commercial services

fields.label: taking part in on-line consultations or voting to define civic or political issues
fields.alt_label: Taking part in on-line consultations or voting
fields.definition: Individuals have used Internet, in the last 3 months, for taking part in on-line consultations or voting to define civic or political issues (e.g. urban planning, signing a petition)
fields.note: Biennial indicator not collected in 2012.

fields.label: Individuals who have never used the internet
fields.alt_label: Individuals who have never used the internet

fields.label: Individuals not allowing use of personal information for advertising
fields.alt_label: Individuals not allowing use of personal information for advertising
fields.definition: Individuals not allowing use of personal information for advertising

fields.label: Security concerns kept individual from ordering or buying online
fields.alt_label: Security concerns kept individual from buying online
fields.definition: Security concerns kept individual from ordering or buying goods or services for private use

fields.label: Individuals experienced financial loss
fields.definition: Individuals experienced financial loss due to fraudulent payment (credit or debit) card use OR as a result of receiving fraudulent messages ('phishing') or getting redirected to fake websites asking for personal information ('pharming').

fields.label: Individuals experienced abuse of personal information and/or other privacy violations
fields.alt_label: Individuals experienced abuse of personal information/privacy violations
fields.definition: Individuals experienced abuse of personal information sent on the Internet and/or other privacy violations (e.g. abuse of pictures, videos, personal data uploaded on community websites)

fields.label: Individuals caught a virus or other computer infection resulting in loss of information or time
fields.definition: Individuals caught a virus or other computer infection (e.g. worm or Trojan horse) resulting in loss of information or time

fields.label: Individuals who have obtained ICT skills through formal educational institutions
fields.alt_label: ICT skills obtained through formal educational institutions
fields.definition: Individuals who have obtained ICT skills through formal educational institutions (school, college, university, etc.)

fields.label: EU R&I committed funding for ICT
fields.alt_label: EU R&I committed funding for ICT
fields.definition: Credit commitments for ICT Research and Innovation, during the reference year.

fields.label: Export of ICT goods and services
fields.alt_label: Export of ICT goods and services
fields.definition: ICT goods include: Computers and peripheral equipment, Communication equipment, Consumer electronic equipment, Electronic components and Miscellaneous. ICT services include: Communications services, Computer and information services. The value of exports cover both intra- and extra- EU.
fields.note: The HS classifications used over time (HS1997, HS2002, HS2007) are bridged using the method described in the OECD document DSTI/ICCP/IIS(2010)5.

fields.label: ICT graduates
fields.definition: Individuals with a degree in ICT

fields.label: High Growth Companies in the ICT sector
fields.definition: High growth companies are companies, with more than 10 employees during the reference year, that grows in employent on average by 10% or more over the last 3 year

fields.label: Import of ICT goods and services
fields.alt_label: Import of ICT goods and services
fields.definition: ICT goods include: Computers and peripheral equipment, Communication equipment, Consumer electronic equipment, Electronic components and Miscellaneous. ICT services include: Communications services, Computer and information services. The value of import cover both intra- and extra- EU.
fields.note: The HS classifications used over time (HS1997, HS2002, HS2007) are bridged using the method described in the OECD document DSTI/ICCP/IIS(2010)5.

fields.label: Persons Employed with ICT Specialist Skills (broad measure)
fields.alt_label: Persons Employed with ICT Specialist Skills (broad measure)
fields.definition: The definition of the ICT Specialists' occupations is based on the new ISCO-08 classification. It includes ICT service managers (code 133), ICT professionals (25), ICT technicians (35) and some other groups, from electronic and telecomunnications engineers (215*) up to ICT installers and servicers (7422). Where 4-digit data was not available, the share of computing graduates in the corresponding 3-digit data was estimated. See metadata fiche for a complete explanation of the methodology (Eurostat table isoc_sks_itspt)
fields.note: The definition of the ICT Specialists' occupations before 2010 is based on ISCO-88. It includes codes 213, 312, 313, 1236, 2144, 2359, 3114, 7242, 7243. Due to change of the classification and the related definition, the data on ICT Specialists for 2011 and later are not fully comparable with previous years.

fields.label: Persons Employed with ICT Specialist Skills
fields.alt_label: Persons Employed with ICT Specialist Skills
fields.definition: The definition of the ICT Specialists' occupations is based on the new ISCO-08 classification. It includes ICT service managers (code 133), ICT professionals (25), ICT technicians (35) and ICT installers and servicers (7422).
fields.note: New ISCO-08 classification of occupations is used from 2011 reference period, replacing the former ISCO-88. Due to change of the classification and the related definition, the data on ICT Specialists for 2011 and later are not fully comparable with previous years.

fields.label: Labour productivity of the ICT sector (per person)
fields.alt_label: Labour productivity of the ICT sector (per person)
fields.definition: Is defined as value added per unit of labour input (persons employed).

fields.label: 3G coverage (2005-2010)
fields.definition: Coverage is a supply indicator defined as the percentage of population living in areas covered by 3G - third generation mobile networks.
fields.note: Indicator collected until 2010. Then replaced with a more specific one on advanced 3G mobile broadband (HSPA).

fields.label: 5G mobile broadband coverage (as a % of households)
fields.definition: Coverage is a supply indicator defined as the percentage of Households living in areas covered by fifth generation mobile broadband.

fields.label: Advanced 3G mobile broadband (HSPA) coverage (as a % of households)
fields.definition: Coverage is a supply indicator defined as the percentage of Households living in areas covered by advanced third generation mobile broadband (HSPA protocol)

fields.label: 4G mobile broadband (LTE) coverage (as a % of households)
fields.definition: Coverage is a supply indicator defined as the percentage of Households living in areas covered by advanced fourth generation mobile broadband (LTE protocol)

fields.label: Take-up of mobile broadband (subscriptions/100 people)
fields.definition: Mobile Broadband penetration is defined as the number of active mobile broadband SIM cards per 100 people.

fields.label: Rural 5G mobile broadband coverage (as a % of households)
fields.definition:
Coverage is a supply indicator defined as the percentage of Households living in areas covered by fifth generation mobile broadband. 
Rural areas are defined as those with less than 100 people per km2.

fields.label: Rural advanced 3G mobile broadband (HSPA) coverage (as a % of households)
fields.definition: Coverage is a supply indicator defined as the percentage of Households living in areas covered by advanced third generation mobile broadband (HSPA protocol). Rural areas are defined as those with less than 100 people per km2.

fields.label: Rural 4G mobile broadband (LTE) coverage (as a % of households)
fields.definition: Coverage is a supply indicator defined as the percentage of Households living in areas covered by advanced fourth generation mobile broadband (LTE protocol). Rural areas are defined as those with less than 100 people per km2.

fields.label: Average Revenue per Minute in Retail Mobile Voice Communications
fields.alt_label: Average Revenue per Minute in Retail Mobile Voice Communications
fields.definition: Total voice related retail revenues divided by total voice minutes

fields.label: Average Revenue per User (ARPU) in the Retail Mobile Market
fields.alt_label: Average Revenue per User (ARPU) in the Retail Mobile Market
fields.definition: Total retail mobile revenues divided by number of active SIM cards

fields.label: Market share of leading operator (in % of active SIM cards)
fields.alt_label: Market share of mobile leading operator
fields.definition: Market share of the market leader based on the number of active SIM cards

fields.label: Mobile voice termination rate
fields.definition: Wholesale call termination charges in mobile voice tecephony

fields.label: Take-up of mobile  - active SIM cards for voice or data
fields.definition: Number of active SIM cards divided by population. It includes both voice and data services, installed in telephones, modem, usb keys or other devices.

fields.label: Mobile roaming price per minute
fields.definition: Average retail price per minute (in €-cents) on Eurotariff for intra-EEA roaming voice calls made

fields.label: Total number of subscriptions (SIM cards)
fields.definition: Mobile subscriptions are defined as the number of active SIM cards. It includes both voice and data services, installed in telephones, modem, usb keys or other devices.

fields.label: Persons employed which were provided a portable device by their employer (business sector)
fields.alt_label: Persons employed provided with a portable device by their enterprise
fields.definition: The devices (portable computers, tablets, smartphones, PDA phones, etc.) should be provided for business use and the enterprises pay for all or at least up to a limit the subscription and the use costs. Are included only the enterprises with 10 or more persons employed, from all manufacturing and service sectors, excluding the financial sector.
fields.note: The 2011 question was limited to portable devices using at least 3G technology to connect to the internet.

fields.label: Persons employed using computers with access to the Web at work (business sector)
fields.alt_label: Persons employed using computers at work
fields.definition: The computers (desktop, laptop, smartphones, etc.) should have access to the World Wide Web and be used at least once a week. Are included only the enterprises with 10 or more persons employed, from all manufacturing and service sectors, excluding the financial sector.
fields.note: Only the business sector is included in the scope: NACEv2 sectors from C10 to N82 (withouk financial services K) + S951.

fields.label: Total population
fields.definition: Total population estimate 1st of January of the same year (Eurostat table demo_pjan)

fields.label: Monthly price of  Fixed Broadband Internet Access offers including Fixed Telephony
fields.alt_label: Monthly price of  Internet + Fixed Telephony
fields.definition: Monthly price of Fixed Broadband Internet Access offers including Fixed Telephony, including value added tax, excluding the aditional cost of telephony or cable line (if any). The minimum and median prices refer to the group of similar subscriptions offered by internet service providers. Offers are not weigthed with market shares, so the offers' median price cannot be interpreted as the median price paid by consumers.
fields.note: If no data is present for a country, it is because no corresponding offers have been found on the national market.

fields.label: Monthly price of Internet Acccess + Fixed Telephony + TV bundles
fields.alt_label: Monthly price of Internet + Fixed Telephony + TV
fields.definition: Monthly price of Fixed Broadband Internet Access offers including Fixed Telephony and TV (analogue or digital television service), including value added tax, excluding the aditional cost of telephony or cable line (if any). The minimum and median prices refer to the group of similar subscriptions offered by internet service providers. Offers are not weigthed with market shares, so the offers' median price cannot be interpreted as the median price paid by consumers.
fields.note: If no data is present for a country, it is because no corresponding offers have been found on the national market.

fields.label: Monthly price of standalone internet access
fields.alt_label: Monthly price of Internet Access only
fields.definition: Monthly price of standalone Fixed Broadband Internet Access offers, including value added tax, excluding the additional cost of telephony or cable line (if any). The minimum and median prices refer to the group of similar subscriptions offered by internet service providers. Offers are not weigthed with market shares, so the offers' median price cannot be interpreted as the median price paid by consumers.
fields.note: If no data is present for a country, it is because no corresponding offers have been found on the national market.

fields.label: Spectrum assigned for wireless broadband in EU harmonised bands
fields.definition: Amount of spectrum assigned by Member States for wireless mobile broadband comunications (WBB) within the ranges harmonised by the European Union. Charts allow to compare with the total value of EU HARMONISED bands and with a simple EU AVERAGE of countries assignements. The policy target is to harmonise and assign 1200 MHz to WBB.

fields.label: Science and technology graduates
fields.definition: Tertiary graduates in science and technology per 1 000 inhabitants aged 20-29 years includes new tertiary graduates in a calendar year from both public and private institutions completing graduate and post graduate studies compared to an age group that corresponds to the typical graduation age in most countries.

fields.label: Fixed voice termination rate
fields.definition: Wholesale call termination charges of the incumbent operator in fixed voice tecephony for local calls

fields.label: Total investment in networks by the electronic communications sector
fields.alt_label: Total investment in networks by the electronic communications sector
fields.definition: Total investment includes both tangible and intangible investment in telecommunication networks (without license fees) by all telecom operators

fields.label: Local Loop Unbundling: total monthly charge
fields.alt_label: Local Loop Unbundling: total monthly charge
fields.definition: The monthly total wholesale cost for Local Loop Unbundling charged by incumbent operators, Calculated as the sum of the monthly charge and 1/36  of the conncetion fee

fields.label: Total revenues of the electronic communications sector
fields.alt_label: Total revenues of the electronic communications sector
fields.definition: Total includes wholesale and retail revenues from electronic communications perceived in the reference year by all telecom operators (VAT excluded)

fields.label: Transparency Score of eGovernment Services
fields.definition: The Transparency score indicates to what extent eGovernment services are transparent. It assesses three aspects of transparency: to what extent public authorities are transparent regarding their own responsibilities and performance, to what extent they are transparent regarding the process of service delivery, and to what extent they are transparent regarding the personal data involved in service delivery.

fields.label: User Centricity Score of eGovernment services
fields.definition: The User centricity score indicates to what extent (information about) a service is provided online and how usable it is (e.g., if support, help and feedback functionality exist online), as well as quality assessments by researchers on the service's ease and speed of use.

fields.label: Value added of the ICT sector
fields.alt_label: Value added of the ICT sector
fields.definition: Value added. In the System of National Accounts it is defined as the value of output less the value of intermediate consumption; it is a measure of the contribution to GDP made by an individual producer, industry or sector.

fields.label: 2 Internet user skills
fields.definition: WID Internet user skills dimension calculated as the weighted average of the three indicators: 2.1 At least basic digital skills  (33.3%), 2.2 Above basic digital skills (33.3%), 2.3 Software skills (33.3%).

fields.label: 2.2 Above basic digital skills
fields.definition: People with above basic digital skills in each of the following four dimensions: information, communication, problem solving, software for content creation.

fields.label: 2.1 At least basic digital skills
fields.definition: People with  at least basic digital skills in each of the following four dimensions: information, communication, problem solving, software for content creation. People possessing, at a minimum, the skills required to perform activities such as using e-mail, editing tools, installing new devices, etc. Further details on calculation methodology here: https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/news/new-comprehensive-digital-skills-indicator

fields.label: 2.3 Software skills
fields.definition: People who, in addition to having used basic software features such as word processing, used advanced spreadsheet functions, created a presentation or document integrating text, pictures and tables or charts, or wrote code in a programming language.

fields.label: Women in Digital (WID) score
fields.definition: Women in digital score calculated as the weighted average of the three sub-dimensions: 1 Use of internet  (33.3%), 2 Internet users skills (33.3%), 3 Specialist skills and employment (33.3%).

fields.label: 3 Specialist skills and employment
fields.definition:
WID Use of Internet Dimension calculated as the weighted average of the three indicators: 
3.1 STEM graduates (33.3%), 3.2 ICT specialists (33.3%), 3.3 Gender pay gap  (33.3%).

fields.label: 3.3 Gender pay gap
fields.definition: Gender pay gap in unadjusted form, measured as the difference between average gross hourly earnings of male paid employees and  female paid employees as a percentage of average gross hourly earnings of male paid employees. The indicator has been defined as unadjusted, because it gives an overall picture of gender inequalities in terms of pay and measures a concept which is broader than the concept of equal pay for equal work. All employees working in firms with ten or more employees, without restrictions for age and hours worked, are included.

fields.label: 3.2 ICT specialists
fields.definition: Employed ICT specialists. Broad definition based on the ISCO-08 classification and including jobs like ICT service managers, ICT professionals, ICT technicians, ICT installers and servicers.

fields.label: 3.1 STEM graduates
fields.definition: People with a degree in a science, technology, maths or engineering-related subject

fields.label: 1 Use of internet
fields.definition:
WID Use of internet dimension calculated as the weighted average of the six indicators: 
1.1 Regular internet use (16.67%), 1.2 People who never used the internet (16.67%), 1.3 Online banking (16.67%), 1.4 Doing an online course (16.67%), 1.5 Online consultations or voting (16.67%), 1.6 eGovernment users (16.67%).

fields.label: 1.6 eGovernment users
fields.definition: People who sent filled forms to public authorities, over the internet, previous 12 months

fields.label: 1.3 Online banking
fields.definition: People who used the Internet to use online banking

fields.label: 1.1 Regular internet use
fields.definition: People who used the Internet at least once a week

fields.label: 1.2 People who never used the internet
fields.alt_label: 1.2 People who never used the internet
fields.definition: People who never used the Internet

fields.label: 1.4 Doing an online course
fields.definition: People who used the Internet for doing an online course (on any subject)

fields.label: 1.5 Online consultations or voting
fields.definition: People who took part in on-line consultations or voting to define civic or political issues (e.g. urban planning, signing a petition)
